events.description: The release of data regarding total consumer credit, revolving credit, and nonrevolving credit for December 2025.

facts.fact_text: Total US consumer credit rose by $24.05 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Total US consumer credit rose by $24.05 billion in December 2025

facts.fact_text: Market expectations for the consumer credit increase were $8 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: way above market expectations of an $8 billion increase.

facts.fact_text: Revolving credit increased by $13.85 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Revolving credit increased by $13.85 billion in December, after decreasing $1.69 billion in November.

facts.fact_text: Nonrevolving credit rose $10.20 billion in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Nonrevolving credit, which includes auto and student loans, rose $10.20 billion in December

claims.claim_text: The rise in consumer credit was significantly higher than what analysts anticipated.

evidences.evidence_text: US Consumer Credit Rises Much more than Expected in December

evidence.evidence_text: It is equivalent to an increase of about 5.7% at an annual rate.
Revolving credit increased by $13.85 billion in December, after decreasing $1.69 billion in November.
